extraction_metadata.article_title: The relationship between Open Innovation and Strategy: data-driven analysis of the Mobile Value Services Industry

extracted_data.question_text: What is the name and definition of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Open Innovation - a model allowing the commercialization of both the ideas of a company as well as ideas coming from other firms
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'Open innovation was originally defined as "a model allowing the commercialization of both the ideas of a company as well as ideas coming from other firms" [1] [2]'

extracted_data.question_text: What synonyms or alternative terms are used in the article to refer to this software business model?
extracted_value: OI
open innovation paradigm
open approach
open business model
open innovation philosophy
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'Open Innovation (OI)' | Page 3: 'open innovation paradigm' | Page 6: 'open business model' | Page 7: 'Open Innovation "philosophy"'

extracted_data.question_text: Which Business Model Canvas elements are detailed in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Value Proposition: Open innovation enabling commercialization of external and internal ideas
Customer Segment: Mobile industry firms and developers
Key Partnerships: Third-party developers and external partners
Revenue Streams: Application sales, marketplace fees, revenue sharing
Key Activities: Open innovation orchestration, partner management
Key Resources: Open platforms, software development kits, partner networks
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'commercialization of both the ideas of a company as well as ideas coming from other firms' | Page 6: 'open network of independent software developers' | Page 4: 'revenues and margins from applications' | Page 6: 'open platforms and software development kits'

extracted_data.question_text: Which actors participate in the ecosystem of the software business model presented in the article and how do they interact?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Device Manufacturers | Platform providers | App Store operators | Independent software developers | Mobile Network Operators | Mobile Content & Service Providers | End customers
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3: 'Device Manufacturer' (Apple, Nokia), 'Mobile Platform Provider' (Google), 'Mobile Network Operator' (Vodafone, TIM), 'Mobile Content & Service Provider' (Buongiorno, Dada) | Page 6: 'independent software developers' | Page 4: 'customers'

extracted_data.question_text: What motivations lead to the adoption of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_value: Extend the company's reach
Leverage external sources of innovation
Renew or reinvent the company's value proposition
Extend the product/service line
Achieve competitive advantage
Lower market entry barriers
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 7: 'extend the company's reach' | Page 7: 'leverage external sources of innovation and value to renew or reinvent the company's value proposition' | Page 7: 'extend the product/service line' | Page 4: 'gave the company an edge when compared to other competitors' | Page 5: 'lowered the market's entry barriers'

extracted_data.question_text: What factors contribute to the success of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Proper partner selection → Successful value creation
Effective communication and managerial commitment → Better collaboration
Good relationship management → Sustained partnerships
Internal culture of change → Organizational adaptation
Control over knowledge and core resources → Competitive advantage
Revenue sharing agreements → Partner motivation
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 8: 'wrong partner selection; lack of communication and managerial commitment; poor relationship management; inadequate internal culture of change; loss of control over knowledge and core resources' | Page 6: 'incentivizing revenue sharing agreements'

extracted_data.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Absorptive capacity → Knowledge integration
Open organizational culture → External collaboration
Strategic alignment → OI-Strategy integration
Resource allocation → OI project support
External environment analysis → Opportunity identification
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 8: 'Absorptive capacity and the integration of the acquired external knowledge are essential' | Page 2: 'insufficient analysis of the external opportunities and threats affecting the OI endeavor' | Page 2: 'scarce resource allocation to the OI project'

extracted_data.question_text: What restrictions or incompatibilities are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: High number of third parties to manage → Operational complexity
Interoperability issues → Value creation problems
Transaction costs higher than transaction value → Profitability issues
Co-opetition orchestration costs → Relationship management challenges
Intellectual property protection costs → Value capture barriers
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 5: 'criticalities in the high number of third parties to be managed and interoperability issues determined both value creation and value capture problems' | Page 8: 'transaction cost higher sometimes than transaction value' | Page 8: 'co-opetition orchestration costs' | Page 8: 'intellectual property management and protection costs'

extracted_data.question_text: What challenges are identified in implementing the software business model as presented in the article?
extracted_value: Designing an open business model
Achieving competitive advantage through value capture
Nurturing OI as a dynamic capability
Integration with existing closed models
Strategic planning alignment
Partner selection and management
Knowledge and resource control
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 7: 'designing an open business model' | Page 7: 'achieving competitive advantage through value capture' | Page 7: 'nurturing OI as a dynamic capability' | Page 7: 'integration of the open business model with the preexisting "closed" models' | Page 8: 'wrong partner selection' | Page 8: 'loss of control over knowledge and core resources'

extracted_data.question_text: What practices are used to mitigate challenges of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Revenue sharing agreements → Partner motivation → Sustained collaboration
Open organizational culture → Change management → Better adaptation
Strategic integration → OI-Strategy alignment → Consistent performance
Absorptive capacity development → Knowledge integration → Innovation capability
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 6: 'incentivizing revenue sharing agreements' | Page 8: 'internal culture of change' | Page 2: 'insufficient linkage between the OI endeavor and the firm's internal strengths and weaknesses' | Page 8: 'Absorptive capacity and the integration of the acquired external knowledge are essential'

extracted_data.question_text: What metrics and quantitative results are reported in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Metric: Number of firms interviewed; Value: 15; Unit: firms; Period: 2012; Method: Qualitative interviews; Source: Primary research | Metric: Number of interviews conducted; Value: 45; Unit: interviews; Period: June-December 2012; Method: Face-to-face semi-structured interviews; Source: Primary research | Metric: Number of partners in Ericsson collaboration; Value: 41; Unit: partners; Period: not specified; Method: Case study; Source: Primary research
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3: 'fifteen firms involved in OI initiatives were selected' | Page 3: 'forty-five face-to-face semi-structured interviews were held' | Page 6: 'very large and ambitious open collaboration with 41 partners'

extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1: 'academic and practitioner studies on the subject amassed in the last decade 2003 – 2013' | Page 1: 'Open Innovation (OI) has gained growing importance'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the type of evidence presented in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3: 'fifteen firms involved in OI initiatives were selected' | Page 3: 'forty-five face-to-face semi-structured interviews' - multiple case study approach

extracted_data.question_text: Which companies or products are cited as examples of the software business model in the article?
extracted_value: Apple → App Store open application model
Google (Android) → Open platform and ecosystem approach
Vodafone → Open partnering with third parties for content and services
Getjar → Open network of independent software developers
Nokia → Open innovation through Nokia Ventures Organization
Ericsson → Open collaboration with 41 partners for network solutions
Wind → iMode open ecosystem adoption (failed case)
TIM → Open business model for TIM Store initiatives
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4: 'Apple. The open approach towards applications developers favored both the iPhone device uptake and the increase of revenues and margins from applications sold on the App Store' | Page 4: 'Google (Android). The open approach towards application developers and device manufacturers enabled the quick diffusion of the Android platform' | Page 4: 'Vodafone. The increasingly open approach towards partnering third parties' | Page 4: 'Getjar. The creation of an open network of independent software developers'

extracted_data.question_text: Are there variations or subtypes of the software business model described in the article?
extracted_value: Open but closed model → Apple's approach with controlled App Store
Fully open approach → Google's Android ecosystem
Open partnering model → Vodafone's third-party collaboration
Open network model → Getjar's developer network
Co-opetitive model → Nokia's relationship with mobile operators
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3: 'Apple's "open but closed model"' | Page 6: 'Google adopts a fully open approach in all the business it covers' | Page 4: 'Vodafone. The increasingly open approach towards partnering third parties' | Page 4: 'Getjar. The creation of an open network of independent software developers' | Page 7: 'Nokia finds itself in a co-opetitive condition with reference to Mobile Network Operators'

extracted_data.question_text: What future trends or evolutions are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Convergence in Fixed, Mobile and Media industries → Expanded market boundaries
Growingly open market → Increased importance of exchanging core resources
Need for continuous strategy adaptation → Dynamic capability development
Future research on new cross paths → Uncovered research streams in Strategic Management
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 5: 'Convergence in the Fixed, Mobile and Media industries expanded the market's boundaries' | Page 8: 'in a growingly open market, exchanging core resources, especially intangibles, is almost as important as owning them' | Page 8: 'companies need to continuously change their Strategy, configuration and relationships with the external environment' | Page 9: 'Future research on the relationship between OI and Strategy should investigate the rise of new cross paths'
